definition: to follow obediently
yes
-ism/only/alone
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: I dislike him because he always does everything as he is told.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌他，因为他总是唯命是从。

sentences.english: That LSD (political party) would curse at dog-like government bureaucrats who obey whatever the Beijing government says?
sentences.chinese: 乱在社民连在议会中用粗口骂对北京唯命是从的狗官？

sentences.english: He does whatever his girlfriend asks him to do. He always wants to please her.
sentences.chinese: 他对女朋友唯命是从，他总是想让她高兴。

sentences.english: That guy is fool for women, who's always at the beck and call of girls.
sentences.chinese: 那家伙是个老色迷，整天跟在女孩子后面唯命是从。

sentences.english: The strong men must have their stooges .
sentences.chinese: 铁腕人物手下一定有唯命是从的人。

sentences.english: He went about very quiet, and in a way, submissive .
sentences.chinese: 他默默无声地走来走去，一副唯命是从的样子。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
docile and obedient/all obedience
totally submissive (idiom)
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
to be a yes-man
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
see 死心塌地[si3 xin1 ta1 di4]
to boss people around (idiom)
submissive/docile/obedient
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
rude and unreasonable
to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
